title: Can I study in law after completing my graduation in philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don't know where you live or what the rules in your country are, but I entered law school after getting a bachelor's degree in philosophy. If you're coming to the United States from a different country, you should consider that the LSAT is very different from most other tests; it requires much more analysis and much less memorization. If you're planning to attend law school in the United States, you should give yourself plenty of time to adjust to the to the different formats of questions and answers.
